roleset.name: be sufficient

example.name: suffice-v: both args
example.text: But there was little selling pressure, and even small orders at the lower levels sufficed [*-1] to bring the market back to Friday's opening levels.
example.arg: even small orders at the lower levels
to bring the market back to Friday's opening levels.

example.name: suffice-v: it-cleft and something else
example.text: [*] Suffice it [*]to say that if this were a New York Yankees-Mets series, or one between the Chicago Cubs and White Sox (hey, it's possible), you'd need uniformed police in every other seat to separate opposing fans, and only the suicidal would bifurcate their bonnets.
example.arg: [*]to say that if this were a New York Yankees-Mets series, or one between the Chicago Cubs and White Sox (hey, it's possible), you'd need uniformed police in every other seat to separate opposing fans, and only the suicidal would bifurcate their bonnets.

example.name: sufficient-j: both args
example.text: Hydroxyglutarate Is Sufficient to Promote Leukemogenesis and Its Effects Are Reversible.

example.name: sufficient-j: self-sufficient
example.text: That is those who [*] develop the best and most efficient renewable / readily accessible power source and are completely self sufficient on it .

roleset.note: SUFFICE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'suffice' based on sentences in wsj (FN sufficiency), 'sufficient' based on BOLT-1. No Verbnet entry. (from suffice.01-v)
SUFFICIENT-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from sufficient.01-j)
